All Recipes

Mexican Bowl

36 min
4 Servings
Easy

Ingredients

For 4 servings

  • 1 pack planted
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh herbs for garnish
üå±

Better for the Planet

By choosing planted, this recipe uses up to 97% less CO2 than traditional meat dishes.

97% Less CO2
99% Less Water

Instructions

  1. 1

    Cook rice according to package instructions. Fluff with a fork and stir in lime juice and chopped cilantro.

  2. 2

    Season the planted with cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika, and garlic powder. Saut√© in olive oil until crispy and browned, about 5-6 minutes.

  3. 3

    Prepare toppings: drain and rinse black beans, slice avocado, dice tomatoes, and shred lettuce.

  4. 4

    Char corn in a hot dry pan until slightly blackened. Prepare quick-pickled red onions with lime juice and salt.

  5. 5

    Assemble bowls: layer cilantro-lime rice, black beans, seasoned planted, corn, tomatoes, and avocado.

  6. 6

    Top with shredded cheese, sour cream, fresh salsa, and a generous handful of fresh cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.

Chef Tips

üî•

Don't overcook! Plant-based proteins cook faster than traditional meat.

üßÇ

Season generously and let the flavors develop while cooking.

‚ùÑÔ∏è

Bring planted products to room temperature before cooking for best results.
